subject: Medicine
title: Medical Deserts
description: A quick win: understand Medical Deserts.

hook.text: 80 million Americans live in areas with no nearby hospital or doctor. Geography determines their healthcare.

buildup.text: Medical deserts are regions with severe shortages of healthcare facilities, providers, and emergency services.

discovery.text: Rural hospitals are closing at record ratesâ€”over 130 since 2010â€”leaving communities without emergency care.

twist.text: Telemedicine expanded access during COVID-19, but many rural areas lack the internet needed to use it.

climax.text: Equal healthcare requires not just insurance coverage but physical access to actual providers and facilities.

punchline.text: Coverage means nothing without a doctor in reach.

quiz.question: What limits telemedicine as a solution for medical deserts?
options: Many rural areas lack reliable internet access
Telemedicine is illegal in most US states
Patients prefer in-person visits for all conditions
